translated: This is not something that Meng can fully express.🔽Is he a sage?
Is he a worthy?
How great! The great mass of qi exhales,
And the six directions give rise to wind.
This is the great fame of the Master.
Wandering dragons and soaring phoenixes,
Bowing to the lower ranks of the nest and the Xu family. This is the lofty Way of the Master.
The autumn colors of the four seas rise in the mountains of the spirits.
This is the demeanor of the Master.
White clouds, vermilion valleys, jade trees, and jeweled grasses.
This is where the Master resides.
Meng was born after the Master,
Although he admires him, he also feels regret.
Respectfully gazing at the remaining image,
His lofty thoughts transcend the ordinary.
He wishes to write with his poor brush on the walls of the house.
In the second spring of the first year of the Qianyuan era of the Great Song Dynasty.
Written by the monk Qisong of Tsinan.
